title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety 
Standards for Protection Against Dangers Arising from Medical Exposure to 
Ionising Radiation) (Amendment) Regulations 2025. 

(2) The Principal Regulations, the European Union (Basic Safety Standards 
for Protection Against Dangers Arising from Medical Exposure to Ionising 
Radiation) (Amendment) Regulations 2019 (S.I. No. 332 of 2019), the European 
Union (Basic Safety Standards for Protection Against Dangers Arising from 
Medical Exposure to Ionising Radiation) (Amendment) (No. 2) Regulations 
2019 (S.I. No. 413 of 2019), the European Union (Basic Safety Standards for 
Protection Against Dangers Arising from Medical Exposure to Ionising 
Radiation) (Amendment) Regulations 2022 (S.I. No. 528 of 2022), the European 
Union (Basic Safety Standards for Protection Against Dangers Arising from 
Medical Exposure to Ionising Radiation) (Amendment) Regulations 2023 (S.I. 
No. 29 of 2023) and these Regulations may be cited together as the European 
Union (Basic Safety Standards for Protection Against Dangers Arising from 
Medical Exposure to Ionising Radiation) Regulations 2018 to 2025. 

(3) These Regulations will come into operation on 12th June 2025.

2.

title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety
heading: 3. Regulation 4(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended as follows:
text_raw:
3. Regulation 4(1) of the Principal Regulations is amended as follows: 

(1) By deleting the word “or” at the end of (d), replacing the full stop at the 
end of (e) with a comma and inserting the word “or” after the comma at the end 
of “(e)”. 

1 OJ No. L 13, 17.1.2014, p. 1. 
2 OJ No. L 72, 17.3.2016, p. 69. 
3 OJ No. L 152, 11.6.2019, p. 128. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 13th June, 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [245] 3 

(2) By inserting after (e) the following: 

“(f) a person whose name is entered in the register established and maintained 
by the Physiotherapists Registration Board pursuant to section 36 of the Health 
and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (No. 27 of 2005), only if such person 
meets the standards and requirements set down from time to time by the 
Physiotherapists Registration Board in relation to the referral for medical 
ionising radiation by physiotherapists.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

9 June, 2025. 

JENNIFER CARROLL MACNEILL, 

Minister for Health. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [245]

title: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the European Union (Basic Safety Standards for 
Protection Against Dangers Arising from Medical Exposure to Ionising 
Radiation) Regulations 2018 so that persons on the Register of Physiotherapists 
(maintained by the Physiotherapists Registration Board) who also meet the 
standards and requirements set down from time to time by the Physiotherapists 
Registration Board may be referrers for the purposes of Regulation 4(1) of the 
European Union (Basic Safety Standards for Protection Against Dangers Arising 
from Medical Exposure to Ionising Radiation) Regulations 2018. 

These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Basic Safety Standards 
for Protection Against Dangers Arising from Medical Exposure to Ionising 
Radiation) (Amendment) Regulations 2025. 

 
 
 
 
 
 [245] 5
